message_1: What is the bond energy required to break one mole of O-H bonds in a water molecule (H2O)?
message_2: The bond energy required to break one mole of O-H bonds in a water molecule (H2O) is approximately 463 kJ/mol. However, since there are two O-H bonds in a water molecule, the total energy required to break all the O-H bonds in one mole of water molecules would be approximately 926 kJ/mol.
